item.title: Rescued at Sea: How Venezuela’s Machado Survived the Riskiest Leg of Her Escape
item.description: The Nobel Peace Prize winner was lost in the Caribbean with no communication for hours before an extraction team found her.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: The Big Fight Over a ‘Fish Disco’ at a British Power Plant
item.description: Plans to use a deep-sea boom box to keep fish away from a coastal nuclear plant have gone awry. DJing for marine life, it turns out, is a nightmare.
item.dc:creator: Eliot Brown

item.title: Trump Says Ukraine Is Losing the War. Officers on the Front Line Disagree.
item.description: Kyiv’s military faces major challenges against Moscow’s massive army, but analysts say a Russian breakthrough is highly unlikely.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: The Hunt for Assad’s Brutal Enforcer
item.description: Jamil Hassan left behind a legacy of deaths and torture when he escaped the Syrian revolution last year. Now his former victims are trying to bring him to justice.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Seizure of Venezuelan Oil Strikes at the Heart of Maduro’s Grip on Power
item.description: U.S. officials said they plan to confiscate more crude tankers in an effort to oust the strongman.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Opinion | The Real Reason Europe Is ‘Decaying’
item.description: The Continent faces a crisis, but not one JD Vance wants to admit.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump Puts the Oil Squeeze on Maduro
item.description: The U.S. hits the regime in the pocketbook, and let’s hope there’s more.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Another $12 Billion for a Tariff Bailout
item.description: Trump’s latest round of aid for U.S. farmers hurt by his global trade wars.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | The Gaza Militias That Can Defeat Hamas
item.description: Groups like the Counter-Terrorism Strike Force can make President Trump’s peace plan into a reality.
item.dc:creator: Hussam Al Astal

item.title: Opinion | Notable & Quotable: Machado
item.description: ‘Freedom is a choice that must be renewed each day, measured by our willingness and our courage to defend it.’

item.title: Opinion | Don’t Listen to the Reports of Ireland’s Demise
item.description: Former Amb. Daniel Mulhall replies to Dominic Green.

item.title: Ukraine Pitches Trump on Vision for Peace, but Tensions Over Territory Remain
item.description: European leaders seek talks this weekend with the U.S. president, who wants more pressure on Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Mexico Slaps Up to 50% Tariffs on Chinese Goods, Drawing Outcry From Beijing
item.description: Lawmakers pass levies targeting countries that Mexico has no trade agreement with, including China.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: EU Launches In-Depth Foreign Subsidies Probe Into China’s Nuctech
item.description: The bloc said Nuctech might have received grants, preferential tax measures and loans which could have improved its competitive position in Europe.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Wave of Gen-Z Unrest Fells Its First European Government
item.description: Bulgaria’s government collapsed following youth-driven street protests of the kind that have swept parts of the globe.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Philippines Typhoon Survivors Sue Shell Over Its Role in Climate Change
item.description: Claimants say the oil giant has known for decades that burning fossil fuel contributes to global warming, something the company disputes.
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Khan

item.title: Crumbling Peace Deals Show Limits of Trump’s Approach to Ending Wars
item.description: The president has claimed credit for ending wars in Congo and at the Thai-Cambodian border, but fighting continues.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Venezuelan Nobel Laureate Praises Trump Pressure on Maduro
item.description: María Corina Machado, speaking after her daring escape from Venezuela, said the administration’s actions were necessary in the fight for democracy.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Disguised and in Danger: How a Nobel Peace Prize Winner Escaped Venezuela
item.description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado slipped through 10 military checkpoints to reach a fishing boat bound for Curaçao and a private jet headed to Norway.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Thyssenkrupp Shutters Electrical Steel Plants, Warns of Potential Job Losses
item.description: Plants in Germany and France would be closed from mid-December until the end of the year as a response to imports that it says are undermining the European steel sector.
item.dc:creator: Adam Whittaker

item.title: China Vows to Boost Domestic Demand
item.description: Chinese officials pledged to prioritize supporting domestic demand in their policy road map for 2026.

item.title: U.S. Flies Bombers in High-Profile Show of Support for Japan
item.description: U.S. B-52s and Japanese jets flew over the Sea of Japan, showcasing their alliance amid tensions between Tokyo and Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Meet the Multinational Cast of Fighters Inside a Ukrainian POW Camp
item.description: Fighters from among 30 nationalities are taking stock of their next step as the U.S. pushes peace talks that would free all prisoners. Many say they plan to go to Russia rather than return to their homelands.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: U.S. Seizes Oil Tanker Off Venezuela in Escalation of Pressure on Maduro Regime
item.description: The move comes amid heightened tension between Washington and Caracas, and hours after the country’s opposition leader left the country on a boat.
item.dc:creator: Collin Eaton

item.title: China’s AI Power Play: Cheap Electricity From World’s Biggest Grid
item.description: Government push for power supremacy transforms Inner Mongolia. Tech leaders worry about a U.S.-China “electron gap.”
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: U.S. Blueprint to Rewire Economies of Russia, Ukraine Sets Off Clash With Europe
item.description: Undisclosed appendices to current peace proposals detail the Trump administration’s plan to unlock frozen Russian funds held in Europe and bring Moscow in from the cold.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hinshaw

item.title: A Blueprint for Louvre Heist Lay Buried in the Museum’s Own Archives
item.description: A security assessment years before the robbery sketched out how a moving truck could access the museum’s second floor.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Dalton

item.title: Using Russian Assets to Help Ukraine Is Looking Like Europe’s Least-Bad Option
item.description: Failure to tap the assets would be devastating for Ukraine on the battlefield and at the negotiating table.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Machado Made It Out of Venezuela by Boat a Day Before Nobel Ceremony
item.description: The opposition leader didn’t reach Oslo in time to collect Peace Prize but said she would be traveling to Norway.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Eni Makes Gas Discovery in Indonesia
item.description: The Konta-1 exploration well showed an estimated potential for a gas rate of up to 80 million standard cubic feet per day.

item.title: China Is Too Big to Rely on Exports for Growth, IMF Chief Warns
item.description: On a visit to Beijing, the economist urged the government to get people spending more.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: Social-Media Ban Imposes Brave New World on Australian Teens
item.description: Under-16s and parents are divided over the merits of evicting youth from their online lives.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Russian and Chinese Bombers Fly Joint Patrol Close to Japan
item.description: Tokyo says the exercise was a show of force amid tensions with Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: America Has a New Ally in Syria and Wants Israel to Get on Board
item.description: Israel’s aggressive posture toward the new government in Damascus has emerged as a rare point of disagreement with Washington, which has embraced Syria’s new leader.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Trump and U.S. CEOs Agree: European Red Tape Goes Too Far
item.description: American executives see an opportunity to shape EU policy as the bloc seeks to trim its own regulations.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Inside Ukraine’s Daring ‘Operation Spiderweb’ Attack on Russia
item.description: Kyiv’s plan to smuggle more than 100 drones into enemy territory required meticulous planning, high-tech gadgets—and luck.
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: Trump Pushes Ukraine to Accept Peace Deal, Saying It Is Losing
item.description: The president called European leaders weak and said Russia holds the cards in any negotiation.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Nvidia AI Chips to Undergo Unusual U.S. Security Review Before Export to China
item.description: Shipping chips from Taiwan to the U.S. to China would allow government to get 25% cut of sales.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Whelan

item.title: Former Honduran President Pardoned by Trump Has Arrest Warrant at Home
item.description: Interpol is urged to arrest Juan Orlando Hernández, who was serving a 45-year prison sentence in the U.S. for drug trafficking.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: U.K. Budget Measures Likely to Lower Inflation Rate, Says BOE’s Lombardelli
item.description: Measures announced by the U.K. government in its budget will likely lower the annual rate of inflation, but it is not clear that interest rates will follow, Bank of England Deputy Gov. Clare Lombardelli said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: How Trump’s U-Turn on Nvidia Chips Changes the Game for China’s AI
item.description: President Trump’s deal instantly reshaped the U.S.-China technological Cold War. The fear among his critics is he just helped Beijing catch up.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Gaza Sits Under 68 Million Tons of Rubble. A Look at the Daunting Task Ahead.
item.description: One way to measure the scale of the damage: If the debris were spread over Manhattan, there would be 215 pounds on every square foot.
item.dc:creator: Emma Brown

item.title: 100 Nigerian Students Freed After Kidnapping at Catholic School
item.description: The Nigerian government said 100 of the students abducted from a Catholic school just over two weeks ago have been freed.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Trump-Brokered Cease-Fire Crumbles on Thai-Cambodian Border
item.description: The Thai army said it launched airstrikes in response to earlier fire from the Cambodian side.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Israel Closes In on Hamas Fighters Trapped in Tunnels, Testing Cease-Fire
item.description: Near-daily exchanges of fire are extending the fighting and creating a roadblock in peace talks.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Targets Even Closest Wartime Allies
item.description: The door is now shut to some 265,000 Afghans waiting to come, many of whom worked with the U.S. or have loved ones who did.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: U.S. Flips History by Casting Europe—Not Russia—as Villain in New Security Policy
item.description: An annual strategy document, which has described threats from China to Russia, directs some of its harshest language at NATO allies.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: U.A.E.’s Ransom Payment for Kidnapped Prince Bolsters al Qaeda in Mali
item.description: Jihadists received millions of dollars as they blockade the country’s capital and security across the region deteriorates.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: For First Time in Decades, Child Deaths Will Rise This Year
item.description: Almost a quarter of a million more children around the world are projected to die in 2025 than in 2024.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Oil Rises as Peace Talks Are Yet to Yield Results
item.description: Oil futures rose as Russia-Ukraine peace talks had yet to produce results while crude supplies remained elevated.

item.title: Ukraine Goes After Moscow’s Shadow Fleet in International Waters
item.description: Recent strikes are hitting at the core of Russia’s economy, but they are risky, and their ultimate impact is uncertain.
item.dc:creator: James Marson

item.title: Marathon Russia-U.S. Meeting Yields No Ukraine Peace Deal
item.description: Territory has emerged as one of the main stumbling blocks to a deal. Russia has demanded that Kyiv cede all of the eastern Ukrainian region of the Donbas.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: In Nigeria, Target of a Trump Threat, Parents Fear for Kidnapped Children
item.description: Fed up with Nigeria’s inability to stop mass abductions of students, families ask the U.S. for assistance.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.K. Loosens Bank Capital Demands for First Time Since Financial Crisis
item.description: British banks will no longer need to hold so much capital, as the U.K. joins the U.S. in unwinding some measures put in place after the global financial crisis.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: U.K. Budget Watchdog Head Quits After Early Report Release
item.description: The head of the U.K.’s budget watchdog resigned after a review found the organization had failed to protect its market-sensitive assessment of government measures from premature access.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: After ‘Productive’ Meeting With Ukrainian Negotiators in Florida, U.S. Officials Head to Russia
item.description: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner plan to travel to Moscow for more talks about a possible peace plan.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Scotland Wants to Issue Its Own Bonds. Last Time It Paid With Its Independence.
item.description: The first Scottish bonds in over 300 years, already known as “kilts,” could help exorcise the ghosts of the past.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: Make Money Not War: Trump’s Real Plan for Peace in Ukraine
item.description: The Kremlin pitched the White House on peace through business. To Europe’s dismay, the president and his envoy are on board.
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: U.K. Budget Trims Inflation But Offers Limited Relief for BOE
item.description: The budget is unlikely to cool inflation in a sustained manner that would open the way for many more rate cuts, economists say.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Car Explosion in India’s Capital Kills Eight
item.description: Indian officials said it was too early to say if the blast was the result of a bomb.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Pentagon Review of Aukus Security Pact Worries U.K., Australia
item.description: The review throws into doubt a strategic partnership that aims to give Australia nuclear-powered submarines and deter Chinese aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Russia’s Side Quest to Dominate Africa: Hijack a Videogame
item.description: Players in the ‘African Dawn’ videogame are asked to choose a side aligned with either Russia or the West.
item.dc:creator: Sarah E. Needleman

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
